claim: Favipiravir has been associated with worse health outcomes for COVID-19 patients.
label: REFUTE

claim: If the United States had imposed social-distancing measures one week earlier, 36,000 fewer people would have died from the coronavirus.
label: SUPPORT

claim: People who have COVID-19 antibodies could safely replace other individuals in high-transmission settings.
label: SUPPORT

claim: No individuals in New York City tested positive for antibodies of the novel coronavirus between from April 19-28, 2020.
label: REFUTE

claim: The length of the COVID-19 outbreak cannot be shortened.
label: REFUTE

claim: Individuals immune to the COVID-19 virus can help to reduce the length of the outbreak.
label: SUPPORT

claim: Models projecting  expected number of cases and deaths in the coming weeks due to COVID-19 are perfectly accurate and precise.
label: REFUTE

claim: Models projecting  expected number of cases and deaths in the coming weeks due to COVID-19 are based on little data and have very large uncertainty.
label: SUPPORT

claim: Monoclonal antibodies are distilled from the blood of patients who have recovered from the virus, or mice that have been genetically altered.
label: SUPPORT

claim: Delayed social distancing measures in the United States had no impact on preventing COVID-19 deaths.
label: REFUTE

claim: Delayed social distancing measures in the United States lead to unnecessary COVID-19 deaths of tens of thousands of people.
label: SUPPORT

claim: COVID-19 is dangerous for pregnant women.
label: SUPPORT

claim: Scientists have found that PCR methods are ineffective at detecting virus RNA in respiratory specimens from COVID-19 patients.
